page.title: 11Clubs in Elton/ Birchover
page.content: There are a number of clubs catering for different age and interest groups. In Birchover the main meeting place is the Reading Room which is run by a Village Committee. Here a Mothers and Toddlers Club and a Youth Club each meet once weekly and the W.I. meets once a month.There are two adult foot- ball clubs and one junior club for boys under 14 which play on the Recreation Ground. In Elton, the main meeting place is the Village Hall, a converted Chapel, which was only opened in 1983.The W.I. and the Eltonians, an over 60s club, meet here. The Youth, Mothers and Toddlers, football and cricket clubs all use the Jubilee Field and Pavilion.The Jubilee Field was purchased by Elton Villagers in 1977, the Queen's Silver Jubilee Year, for Â£2,700.
